import React from "react"; import { Bar } from "react-chartjs-2"; import { Chart, CategoryScale, LinearScale, BarElement, Title, Tooltip, Legend } from "chart.js"; import { Card, CardContent } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { ScrollArea } from "@/components/ui/scroll-area"; import { motion } from "framer-motion"; Chart.register(CategoryScale, LinearScale, BarElement, Title, Tooltip, Legend); const sections = [ { title: "Ayurvedic Principles for a Healthy Pregnancy", content: "Pregnancy disrupts Vata, Pitta, and Kapha energies; Ayurveda aims to restore balance through diet, lifestyle, and self-care. Helps reduce stress, promote restful sleep, and enhance baby’s well-being." }, { title: "Ayurvedic Diet for Pregnancy", content: "Eat warm, cooked foods (rice, ghee, milk, turmeric). Avoid raw foods, caffeine, and processed sugar as they disrupt doshas. Maintain good hydration (8-10 glasses daily)." }, { title: "Lifestyle Recommendations", content: "Get extra rest through short breaks and naps. Engage in light exercise (walking, prenatal yoga, swimming). Reduce stress through meditation, prayer, and breathwork. Practice self-massage (Abhyanga) with warm sesame oil for circulation and relaxation." }, { title: "Herbal Support", content: "Herbs like Shatavari, Brahmi, and Aloe Vera help balance hormones and nourish fetal development (consult a doctor before use)." }, { title: "Detox Before Conception", content: "Avoid toxins (alcohol, smoking, junk food). Eat nutrient-rich foods (leafy greens, whole grains, nuts, dairy, legumes). Maintain cleanliness, positive mental health, and good sleep." }, { title: "Best Time to Conceive (According to Ayurveda)", content: "Ovulation period (Day 14 of menstrual cycle, varies per person). Signs: Clear and stretchy cervical mucus, slight temperature increase, mild cramps, positive ovulation test. Best time for conception: The day of ovulation and two days before." }, { title: "General Care Tips", content: "Eat a balanced diet with whole grains, beans, fruits, and vegetables. Stay hydrated, exercise lightly, massage with coconut or sesame oil, meditate, and use Ayurvedic spices." }, { title: "Things to Avoid", content: "Avoid smoking, alcohol, heavy foods, strenuous activities, and suppressing cravings." }, { title: "Ayurvedic Therapies for Pregnancy", content: "Includes oil massage (Abhyanga), Pichu therapy, herbal baths, enema (Matravasti), and yoga (Cat-Cow, Bridge, Balasana)." }, { title: "Diet Recommendations by Trimester", content: "First Trimester: Light, milk-based foods. Second Trimester: Butter and medicated ghee. Third Trimester: Ghee for anemia prevention, Shatavari for lactation." }, { title: "Managing Pregnancy Discomforts with Ayurveda", content: "Nausea: Ginger-lemon juice. Vomiting: Small meals, ginger tea. Headaches: Stay hydrated, use essential oils. Dry mouth: Oil pulling, proper hydration." }, { title: "Managing Common Pregnancy Issues", content: "Fever: Herbal teas, monitor temperature. Anemia: Eat iron-rich foods. Edema: Elevate legs, stay hydrated. Hypertension: Manage stress with yoga and herbal water." }, { title: "Lifestyle Recommendations", content: "Eat well, stay hydrated, exercise, rest well, avoid harmful substances, maintain hygiene, wear comfortable clothing." }, { title: "Ayurvedic Immunity Boosters", content: "Ashwagandha for stress, turmeric for anti-inflammation, ginger for digestion, oil massage for circulation, yoga for well-being." } ]; const DietPlan = () => { const data = { labels: ["Underweight", "Normal weight", "Overweight", "Obese"], datasets: [ { label: "Recommended Weight Gain (kg)", data: [15, 13.75, 9.25, 7], backgroundColor: ["#8e44ad", "#9b59b6", "#d2b4de", "#e8daef"], borderWidth: 1, }, ], }; const options = { responsive: true, maintainAspectRatio: false, scales: { y: { beginAtZero: true, }, }, }; return (
{/* Cover Image */}

Healthy Diet During Pregnancy

{/* Healthy Diet Section */}

During pregnancy, focus on consuming essential nutrients rather than increasing calorie intake. Key nutrients like iron and folate are crucial. Maintaining good food hygiene helps prevent infections like listeriosis and salmonella. Always consult a healthcare professional before taking supplements.

{/* Importance Section */}

Importance of Healthy Weight Gain

  • Supports baby’s growth and development.
  • Essential for maternal health and postpartum recovery.
{/* Risks Section */}

Risks of Excess Weight Gain

  • Increases chances of gestational diabetes and high blood pressure.
  • Can make it harder to lose weight after pregnancy.
{/* Recommended Weight Gain */}

Recommended Weight Gain (Based on BMI)

  • Underweight (BMI < 18.5) → 12.5 - 18 kg
  • Normal weight (BMI 18.5 - 24.9) → 11.5 - 16 kg
  • Overweight (BMI 25 - 29.9) → 7 - 11.5 kg
  • Obese (BMI ≥ 30) → 5 - 9 kg
{/* Chart Section */}

Weight Gain Chart

{/* Healthy Eating for Pregnant Women */}

Healthy Eating for Pregnant Women

What you eat during pregnancy affects not only your own health and well-being but also the development of your baby. There is substantial evidence that it can have a lasting impact on the health and well-being of your child later in life.

Choose a wide variety of healthy foods from the five food groups to meet both your and your baby’s nutritional needs for optimal health and growth. While you may need to eat more of some foods to obtain key nutrients, there is no need to “eat for two.”

What to Include in Your Pregnancy Diet:

  • A variety of fruits and vegetables of different types and colors—ideally 2 servings of fruit and 5 servings of vegetables per day.
  • Increased intake of grain and cereal foods—about 8½ servings per day. Choose mostly wholegrain and high-fiber options.
  • Iron-rich foods such as lean red meat or tofu—3½ servings of meat or meat alternatives are recommended.
  • Calcium-enriched foods like milk, hard cheese, and yogurt—preferably reduced-fat varieties, with 2½ servings per day.
  • Plenty of water to stay hydrated.
  • Limited intake of foods and drinks high in saturated fat, added sugar, and salt.
Food Group Serves per Day Example Serving Size
Vegetables and legumes/beans 5 ½ cup cooked vegetables, 1 cup salad, ½ medium potato
Fruits 2 1 medium fruit, 1 cup diced fruit
Grain foods (wholegrain/high-fibre) 8½ 1 slice bread, ½ cup cooked rice/pasta, 3 crispbreads
Lean meats, poultry, fish, eggs, tofu, nuts, beans 3½ 65g cooked lean meat, 2 eggs, 1 cup beans
Milk, yoghurt, cheese (reduced fat) 2½ 1 cup milk, 2 slices cheese, ¾ cup yoghurt

Pregnancy Nutrition Guide

{/* Folic Acid Section */}

Folic Acid & Pregnancy

Folic acid (folate) is essential for preventing neural tube defects.

Pregnant women should take 500 mcg daily and eat folate-rich foods.

Excellent Sources:

  • Asparagus
  • Bran flakes
  • Broccoli
  • Brussels sprouts
  • Chickpeas
  • Dried beans
  • Lentils
  • Spinach
{/* Iron Section */}

Iron & Pregnancy

Iron is vital for the baby's development and prevents anemia.

Pregnant women need 27 mg of iron daily.

Good Sources:

  • Meat
  • Chicken
  • Seafood
  • Dried beans & lentils
  • Leafy greens
{/* Iodine Section */}

Iodine & Pregnancy

Iodine is crucial for brain development.

Pregnant women should take 150 mcg daily.

Sources:

  • Seafood
  • Seaweed
  • Eggs
  • Meat
  • Dairy
{/* Vitamin D Section */}

Vitamin D & Pregnancy

Vitamin D is important for bone health.

The sun is the best source, but foods like eggs, oily fish, and fortified milk help.

{/* Other Sections */}

Multivitamins & Calcium

Multivitamins are helpful for some pregnant women, like vegans or teenagers.

Extra calcium isn't needed, but dairy and fortified soy milk are good sources.

Dieting & Pregnancy

Crash dieting is harmful. Proper nutrition is crucial for both mother and baby.

Common Pregnancy Issues

Constipation:

Eat fiber-rich foods and drink plenty of water.

Nausea:

Try dry biscuits in the morning and avoid greasy foods.

Heartburn:

Eat small meals and avoid late-night eating.

{/* Video Section */}
{/* Left Side - Content */}
{sections.map((section, index) => (

{section.title}

{section.content}

 ))}
{/* Right Side - Image */}
); }; export default DietPlan;
